isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB DOOR COMPONENTS DISASSEMBLY AND REASSEMBLY - IGNITION KEY SWITCH AND DOOR LOCK CYLINDER REPLACEMENT

svcproc.title: IGNITION KEY SWITCH AND DOOR LOCK CYLINDER REPLACEMENT

svcprocinfo.para: The instrument console mounted key switch and the lock cylinder in the door are coded so that one key operates both. The code number is stamped on the key switch body just back of cap nut. The door lock cylinder assembly does not have a code number stamped on the body since this cylinder is coded to the key switch.

To locate the code number on the key switch, remove key switch mounting cap nut and detach key switch from instrument console. The procedure for removing switch cylinder from switch body is as follows:

step1.para: Unscrew mounting cap nut from key switch.
Using switch key, turn cylinder until key aligns with slot in screw threads now exposed. Remove key.
Insert a small 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) diameter rod (paper clip) in slot in screw threads and depress cylinder retainer ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Releasing Key Switch Cylinder Retainer

step1.para: This will enable you to pull cylinder approximately 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) from switch body.
Reinstall key, and cylinder can now be withdrawn completely ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Removing Cylinder From Key Switch Body

svcsubproc.title: Install

step1.para: To reinstall the old cylinder or to install a new cylinder, push cylinder into switch body and turn to right ("On" position) or until the cylinder retainer snaps into place.

svcsubproc.para: Door lock cylinder replacement is by the complete assembly. Lock cylinder itself (tumbler unit) is not removable. If door lock replacement is required, lock cylinder assemblies should be replaced in pairs (both doors).

If a replacement of key switch cylinder is necessary and the owner/operator desires the original key, the tumblers of the new switch can be coded accordingly. This is accomplished by inserting original key in new cylinder (cylinder removed from body) and filing off the tumblers that protrude from cylinder. When making this change, be sure no burrs are left on tumblers and all filings are blown out with air. Apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to tumblers and reinsert cylinder in key switch body.

note.para: If keys are lost, switch cylinder must be drilled out to make a cylinder replacement. Use a 5/16 inch (8 mm) drill, 1/2 - 3/4 inch (13 - 19 mm) deep. This will permit tumblers to drop out and free lock.
